verses.text: And all the brethren which are with me, unto the churches of Galatia:

similars.text: Salute every saint in Christ Jesus. The brethren which are with me greet you.

verses.text: Grace be to you and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,

The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.

The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.

And may the grace of God the Father, whose throne is high in the heavens, and our Lord Jesus Christ, who sitteth on the right hand of his power, until all things shall become subject unto him, be, and abide with you forever. Amen.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.

Paul, and Silvanus, and Timotheus, unto the church of the Thessalonians which is in God the Father and in the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
To Timothy, my dearly beloved son: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
To all that be in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Unto Timothy, my own son in the faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God our Father and Jesus Christ our Lord.
And this according to the grace of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, to whom be all glory, both now and forever. Amen.
Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
The Lord Jesus Christ be with thy spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.
To Titus, mine own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.
I thank my God always on your behalf, for the grace of God which is given you by Jesus Christ;
And the very God of peace sanctify you wholly; and I pray God your whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blameless unto the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
And the peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.
Grace be with you all. Amen.
Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God, even our Father, which hath loved us, and hath given us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace,
Now God himself and our Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ, direct our way unto you.
Now unto God and our Father be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
Blessed be God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;
Grace be with all them that love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity. Amen.
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ:

And now, I would commend you to seek this Jesus of whom the prophets and apostles have written, that the grace of God the Father, and also the Lord Jesus Christ, and the Holy Ghost, which beareth record of them, may be and abide in you forever. Amen.
We give thanks to God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,
Therefore being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ:
Then said Jesus to them again, Peace be unto you: as my Father hath sent me, even so send I you.
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which according to his abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,
Glory, and honor, and power, and might,Be ascribed to our God; for he is full of mercy,Justice, grace and truth, and peace,Forever and ever, Amen.
Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.

And now, may the peace of God rest upon you, and upon your houses and lands, and upon your flocks and herds, and all that you possess, your women and your children, according to your faith and good works, from this time forth and forever. And thus I have spoken. Amen.

I am mindful of you always in my prayers, continually praying unto God the Father in the name of his Holy Child, Jesus, that he, through his infinite goodness and grace, will keep you through the endurance of faith on his name to the end.
The Lord our God be with us, as he was with our fathers: let him not leave us, nor forsake us:
Now the Lord of peace himself give you peace always by all means. The Lord be with you all.
And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to the which also ye are called in one body; and be ye thankful.
Giving thanks always for all things unto God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;
Sanctify yourselves therefore, and be ye holy: for I am the Lord your God.
Mercy unto you, and peace, and love, be multiplied.
All that are with me salute thee. Greet them that love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.

verses.text: Who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us from this present evil world, according to the will of God and our Father:

similars.text: Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.
Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.

verses.text: To whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

similars.text: Now unto God and our Father be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
To him be glory and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.
For of him, and through him, and to him, are all things: to whom be glory for ever. Amen.
To God only wise, be glory through Jesus Christ for ever. Amen.
Blessed be the Lord for evermore. Amen, and Amen.
For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, forever. Amen.
And this according to the grace of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, to whom be all glory, both now and forever. Amen.
Unto him be glory in the church by Christ Jesus throughout all ages, world without end. Amen.
And blessed be his glorious name for ever: and let the whole earth be filled with his glory; Amen, and Amen.
Saying, Amen: Blessing, and glory, and wisdom, and thanksgiving, and honour, and power, and might, be unto our God for ever and ever. Amen.
To the only wise God our Saviour, be glory and majesty, dominion and power, both now and ever. Amen.
And to God and the Lamb be glory, and honor, and dominion forever and ever. Amen.
But grow in grace, and in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. To him be glory both now and for ever. Amen.
To the end that my glory may sing praise to thee, and not be silent. O Lord my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.
Now unto the King eternal, immortal, invisible, the only wise God, be honour and glory for ever and ever. Amen.
For ye are our glory and joy.
Before whose throne all things bow in humble reverence, and give him glory forever and ever.
The glory of the Lord shall endure for ever: the Lord shall rejoice in his works.
Great shall be their reward and eternal shall be their glory.
For all the promises of God in him are yea, and in him Amen, unto the glory of God by us.
Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting, and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen.
And the Lord God has spoken it; and honor, power and glory be rendered to his holy name, both now and ever. Amen.
Behold, the kingdom is yours. And behold, and lo, I am with the faithful always. Even so. Amen.
Glory, and honor, and power, and might,Be ascribed to our God; for he is full of mercy,Justice, grace and truth, and peace,Forever and ever, Amen.
Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the Lord.
For the Lord God has spoken it; and we, the elders of the church, have heard and bear witness to the words of the glorious Majesty on high, to whom be glory forever and ever. Amen.
Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: let thy glory be above all the earth.
Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens; let thy glory be above all the earth.
And hath made us kings and priests unto God and his Father; to him be glory and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.
Declare his glory among the heathen, his wonders among all people.
I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart: and I will glorify thy name for evermore.
But as truly as I live, all the earth shall be filled with the glory of the Lord.
Blessed be the Lord God of Israel for ever and ever. And all the people said, Amen, and praised the Lord.

Therefore, let us glory, yea, we will glory in the Lord; yea, we will rejoice, for our joy is full; yea, we will praise our God forever. Behold, who can glory too much in the Lord? Yea, who can say too much of his great power, and of his mercy, and of his long-suffering towards the children of men? Behold, I say unto you, I cannot say the smallest part which I feel.
Therefore, be faithful; and behold, and lo, I am with you even unto the end. Even so. Amen.
To him be glory and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.
Now unto God and our Father be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
For of him, and through him, and to him, are all things: to whom be glory for ever. Amen.

And the Lord shall deliver me from every evil work, and will preserve me unto his heavenly kingdom: to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
Blessed be the Lord God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the Lord.

verses.text: I marvel that ye are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ unto another gospel:
Which is not another; but there be some that trouble you, and would pervert the gospel of Christ.

similars.text: If others be partakers of this power over you, are not we rather? Nevertheless we have not used this power; but suffer all things, lest we should hinder the gospel of Christ.

verses.text: But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached unto you, let him be accursed.

similars.text: As we said before, so say I now again, If any man preach any other gospel unto you than that ye have received, let him be accursed.

For if he that cometh preacheth another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or if ye receive another spirit, which ye have not received, or another gospel, which ye have not accepted, ye might well bear with him.

Unto whom it was revealed, that not unto themselves, but unto us they did minister the things, which are now reported unto you by them that have preached the gospel unto you with the Holy Ghost sent down from heaven; which things the angels desire to look into.

And now, verily saith the Lord, that these things might be known among you, O inhabitants of the earth, I have sent forth mine angel flying through the midst of heaven, having the everlasting gospel, who hath appeared unto some and hath committed it unto man, who shall appear unto many that dwell on the earth.
Moreover, brethren, I declare unto you the gospel which I preached unto you, which also ye have received, and wherein ye stand;
And more blessed are you because you are called of me to preach my gospel--
As we said before, so say I now again, If any man preach any other gospel unto you than that ye have received, let him be accursed.
As we said before, so say I now again, If any man preach any other gospel unto you than that ye have received, let him be accursed.

verses.text: As we said before, so say I now again, If any man preach any other gospel unto you than that ye have received, let him be accursed.

similars.text: But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached unto you, let him be accursed.

And again, verily, verily, I say unto you, it is expedient that every man who goes forth to proclaim mine everlasting gospel, that inasmuch as they have families, and receive money by gift, that they should send it unto them or make use of it for their benefit, as the Lord shall direct them, for thus it seemeth me good.
And he shall send Jesus Christ, which before was preached unto you:
Take also your brother, and arise, go again unto the man:
Moreover, brethren, I declare unto you the gospel which I preached unto you, which also ye have received, and wherein ye stand;

Hearken unto my word, my servants Sidney, and Parley, and Leman; for behold, verily I say unto you, that I give unto you a commandment that you shall go and preach my gospel which ye have received, even as ye have received it, unto the Shakers.
And again, to another, that he may prophesy concerning all things;
Again I say unto you, hearken and hear and obey the law which I shall give unto you.
Behold verily, verily, I say unto you, I give unto you another commandment, and then I must go unto my Father that I may fulfil other commandments which he hath given me.
And it shall be fulfilled upon you in that day that you shall have right to preach my gospel wheresoever I shall send you, from henceforth from that time.
For I would that all men were even as I myself. But every man hath his proper gift of God, one after this manner, and another after that.
But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached unto you, let him be accursed.
But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached unto you, let him be accursed.

verses.text: For do I now persuade men, or God? or do I seek to please men? for if I yet pleased men, I should not be the servant of Christ.

similars.text: Seek not to declare my word, but first seek to obtain my word, and then shall your tongue be loosed; then, if you desire, you shall have my Spirit and my word, yea, the power of God unto the convincing of men.

verses.text: But I certify you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached of me is not after man.

similars.text: Moreover, brethren, I declare unto you the gospel which I preached unto you, which also ye have received, and wherein ye stand;

verses.text: For I neither received it of man, neither was I taught it, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.
For ye have heard of my conversation in time past in the Jews' religion, how that beyond measure I persecuted the church of God, and wasted it:
And profited in the Jews' religion above many my equals in mine own nation, being more exceedingly zealous of the traditions of my fathers.
But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother's womb, and called me by his grace,

similars.text: But thou art he that took me out of the womb: thou didst make me hope when I was upon my mother's breasts.
By thee have I been holden up from the womb: thou art he that took me out of my mother's bowels: my praise shall be continually of thee.
I was cast upon thee from the womb: thou art my God from my mother's belly.

verses.text: To reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the heathen; immediately I conferred not with flesh and blood:

similars.text: My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.
I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:
My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;
I will scatter them also among the heathen, whom neither they nor their fathers have known: and I will send a sword after them, till I have consumed them.

verses.text: Neither went I up to Jerusalem to them which were apostles before me; but I went into Arabia, and returned again unto Damascus.
Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and abode with him fifteen days.

similars.text: So I came to Jerusalem, and was there three days.
And we came to Jerusalem, and abode there three days.
Then fourteen years after I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, and took Titus with me also.
So I came to Jerusalem, and was there three days.
And we came to Jerusalem, and abode there three days.
Then fourteen years after I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, and took Titus with me also.

verses.text: But other of the apostles saw I none, save James the Lord's brother.

similars.text: And he suffered no man to follow him, save Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.
After that, he was seen of James; then of all the apostles.

verses.text: Now the things which I write unto you, behold, before God, I lie not.

similars.text: I have not written unto you because ye know not the truth, but because ye know it, and that no lie is of the truth.

And I exhort you to remember these things; for the time speedily cometh that ye shall know that I lie not, for ye shall see me at the bar of God; and the Lord God will say unto you: Did I not declare my words unto you, which were written by this man, like as one crying from the dead, yea, even as one speaking out of the dust?

Behold now, I do not say that these things shall be, of myself, because it is not of myself that I know these things; but behold, I know that these things are true because the Lord God has made them known unto me, therefore I testify that they shall be.
Behold, it is written before me: I will not keep silence, but will recompense, even recompense into their bosom,
Verily, verily, I say unto you, wo be unto him that lieth to deceive because he supposeth that another lieth to deceive, for such are not exempt from the justice of God.
And now I, the Lord, give unto you a testimony of the truth of these commandments which are lying before you.
Now therefore be content, look upon me; for it is evident unto you if I lie.
And God shall show unto you, that that which I have written is true.
I tell thee these things as a witness unto thee--that the words or the work which thou hast been writing are true.

verses.text: Afterwards I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia;

similars.text: And he went through Syria and Cilicia, confirming the churches.

verses.text: And was unknown by face unto the churches of Judaea which were in Christ:
But they had heard only, That he which persecuted us in times past now preacheth the faith which once he destroyed.
And they glorified God in me.

similars.text: But when the multitudes saw it, they marvelled, and glorified God, which had given such power unto men.
